t: Luke 6
And*p it came to pass on the second sabbath after the first, that he went through the corn fields; and his disciples plucked the ears of corn, and did eat, rubbing them in their hands.
And*p certain of the Pharisees said unto them, Why do ye that which is not lawful to do on the sabbath days?
And*p Jesus answering them said, Have*r ye*r not*r read*r so*r much*r as*r this,*r what*r David*r did,*r when*r himself*r was*r an*r hungred,*r and*r they*r which*r were*r with*r him;*r

How*rp he*r went*r into*r the*r house*r of*r God,*r and*r did*r take*r and*r eat*r the*r shewbread,*r and*r gave*r also*r to*r them*r that*r were*r with*r him;*r which*r it*r is*r not*r lawful*r to*r eat*r but*r for*r the*r priests*r alone?*r
And*p he said unto them, That*r the*r Son*r of*r man*r is*r Lord*r also*r of*r the*r sabbath.*r
And*p it came to pass also on another sabbath, that he entered into the synagogue and taught: and there was a man whose right hand was withered.
And*p the scribes and Pharisees watched him, whether he would heal on the sabbath day; that they might find an accusation against him.
But*p he knew their thoughts, and said to the man which had the withered hand, Rise*r up,*r and*r stand*r forth*r in*r the*r midst.*r And he arose and stood forth.

Then*p said Jesus unto them, I*r will*r ask*r you*r one*r thing;*r Is*r it*r lawful*r on*r the*r sabbath*r days*r to*r do*r good,*r or*r to*r do*r evil?*r to*r save*r life,*r or*r to*r destroy*r it?*r
And*p looking round about upon them all, he said unto the man, Stretch*r forth*r thy*r hand.*r And he did so: and his hand was restored whole as the other.
And*p they were filled with madness; and communed one with another what they might do to Jesus.
And*p it came to pass in those days, that he went out into a mountain to pray, and continued all night in prayer to God.
And*p when it was day, he called unto him his disciples: and of them he chose twelve, whom also he named apostles;
Simon,*p (whom he also named Peter,) and Andrew his brother, James and John, Philip and Bartholomew,
Matthew*p and Thomas, James the son of Alphaeus, and Simon called Zelotes,
And*p Judas the brother of James, and Judas Iscariot, which also was the traitor.

And*p he came down with them, and stood in the plain, and the company of his disciples, and a great multitude of people out of all Judaea and Jerusalem, and from the sea coast of Tyre and Sidon, which came to hear him, and to be healed of their diseases;
And*p they that were vexed with unclean spirits: and they were healed.
And*p the whole multitude sought to touch him: for there went virtue out of him, and healed them all.
And*p he lifted up his eyes on his disciples, and said, Blessed*r be*r ye*r poor:*r for*r yours*r is*r the*r kingdom*r of*r God.*r
Blessed*rp are*r ye*r that*r hunger*r now:*r for*r ye*r shall*r be*r filled.*r Blessed*r are*r ye*r that*r weep*r now:*r for*r ye*r shall*r laugh.*r

Blessed*rp are*r ye,*r when*r men*r shall*r hate*r you,*r and*r when*r they*r shall*r separate*r you*r from*r their*r company,*r and*r shall*r reproach*r you,*r and*r cast*r out*r your*r name*r as*r evil,*r for*r the*r Son*r of*r man's*r sake.*r

Rejoice*rp ye*r in*r that*r day,*r and*r leap*r for*r joy:*r for,*r behold,*r your*r reward*r is*r great*r in*r heaven:*r for*r in*r the*r like*r manner*r did*r their*r fathers*r unto*r the*r prophets.*r
But*rp woe*r unto*r you*r that*r are*r rich!*r for*r ye*r have*r received*r your*r consolation.*r
Woe*rp unto*r you*r that*r are*r full!*r for*r ye*r shall*r hunger.*r Woe*r unto*r you*r that*r laugh*r now!*r for*r ye*r shall*r mourn*r and*r weep.*r
Woe*rp unto*r you,*r when*r all*r men*r shall*r speak*r well*r of*r you!*r for*r so*r did*r their*r fathers*r to*r the*r false*r prophets.*r
But*rp I*r say*r unto*r you*r which*r hear,*r Love*r your*r enemies,*r do*r good*r to*r them*r which*r hate*r you,*r
Bless*rp them*r that*r curse*r you,*r and*r pray*r for*r them*r which*r despitefully*r use*r you.*r
And*rp unto*r him*r that*r smiteth*r thee*r on*r the*r one*r cheek*r offer*r also*r the*r other;*r and*r him*r that*r taketh*r away*r thy*r cloak*r forbid*r not*r to*r take*r thy*r coat*r also.*r
Give*rp to*r every*r man*r that*r asketh*r of*r thee;*r and*r of*r him*r that*r taketh*r away*r thy*r goods*r ask*r them*r not*r again.*r
And*rp as*r ye*r would*r that*r men*r should*r do*r to*r you,*r do*r ye*r also*r to*r them*r likewise.*r
For*rp if*r ye*r love*r them*r which*r love*r you,*r what*r thank*r have*r ye?*r for*r sinners*r also*r love*r those*r that*r love*r them.*r
And*rp if*r ye*r do*r good*r to*r them*r which*r do*r good*r to*r you,*r what*r thank*r have*r ye?*r for*r sinners*r also*r do*r even*r the*r same.*r
And*rp if*r ye*r lend*r to*r them*r of*r whom*r ye*r hope*r to*r receive,*r what*r thank*r have*r ye?*r for*r sinners*r also*r lend*r to*r sinners,*r to*r receive*r as*r much*r again.*r

But*rp love*r ye*r your*r enemies,*r and*r do*r good,*r and*r lend,*r hoping*r for*r nothing*r again;*r and*r your*r reward*r shall*r be*r great,*r and*r ye*r shall*r be*r the*r children*r of*r the*r Highest:*r for*r he*r is*r kind*r unto*r the*r unthankful*r and*r to*r the*r evil.*r
Be*rp ye*r therefore*r merciful,*r as*r your*r Father*r also*r is*r merciful.*r
Judge*rp not,*r and*r ye*r shall*r not*r be*r judged:*r condemn*r not,*r and*r ye*r shall*r not*r be*r condemned:*r forgive,*r and*r ye*r shall*r be*r forgiven:*r

Give,*rp and*r it*r shall*r be*r given*r unto*r you;*r good*r measure,*r pressed*r down,*r and*r shaken*r together,*r and*r running*r over,*r shall*r men*r give*r into*r your*r bosom.*r For*r with*r the*r same*r measure*r that*r ye*r mete*r withal*r it*r shall*r be*r measured*r to*r you*r again.*r
And*rp he*r spake*r a*r parable*r unto*r them,*r Can*r the*r blind*r lead*r the*r blind?*r shall*r they*r not*r both*r fall*r into*r the*r ditch?*r
The*rp disciple*r is*r not*r above*r his*r master:*r but*r every*r one*r that*r is*r perfect*r shall*r be*r as*r his*r master.*r
And*rp why*r beholdest*r thou*r the*r mote*r that*r is*r in*r thy*r brother's*r eye,*r but*r perceivest*r not*r the*r beam*r that*r is*r in*r thine*r own*r eye?*r

Either*rp how*r canst*r thou*r say*r to*r thy*r brother,*r Brother,*r let*r me*r pull*r out*r the*r mote*r that*r is*r in*r thine*r eye,*r when*r thou*r thyself*r beholdest*r not*r the*r beam*r that*r is*r in*r thine*r own*r eye?*r Thou*r hypocrite,*r cast*r out*r first*r the*r beam*r out*r of*r thine*r own*r eye,*r and*r then*r shalt*r thou*r see*r clearly*r to*r pull*r out*r the*r mote*r that*r is*r in*r thy*r brother's*r eye.*r
For*rp a*r good*r tree*r bringeth*r not*r forth*r corrupt*r fruit;*r neither*r doth*r a*r corrupt*r tree*r bring*r forth*r good*r fruit.*r
For*rp every*r tree*r is*r known*r by*r his*r own*r fruit.*r For*r of*r thorns*r men*r do*r not*r gather*r figs,*r nor*r of*r a*r bramble*r bush*r gather*r they*r grapes.*r

A*rp good*r man*r out*r of*r the*r good*r treasure*r of*r his*r heart*r bringeth*r forth*r that*r which*r is*r good;*r and*r an*r evil*r man*r out*r of*r the*r evil*r treasure*r of*r his*r heart*r bringeth*r forth*r that*r which*r is*r evil:*r for*r of*r the*r abundance*r of*r the*r heart*r his*r mouth*r speaketh.*r
And*rp why*r call*r ye*r me,*r Lord,*r Lord,*r and*r do*r not*r the*r things*r which*r I*r say?*r
Whosoever*rp cometh*r to*r me,*r and*r heareth*r my*r sayings,*r and*r doeth*r them,*r I*r will*r shew*r you*r to*r whom*r he*r is*r like:*r

He*rp is*r like*r a*r man*r which*r built*r an*r house,*r and*r digged*r deep,*r and*r laid*r the*r foundation*r on*r a*r rock:*r and*r when*r the*r flood*r arose,*r the*r stream*r beat*r vehemently*r upon*r that*r house,*r and*r could*r not*r shake*r it:*r for*r it*r was*r founded*r upon*r a*r rock.*r

But*rp he*r that*r heareth,*r and*r doeth*r not,*r is*r like*r a*r man*r that*r without*r a*r foundation*r built*r an*r house*r upon*r the*r earth;*r against*r which*r the*r stream*r did*r beat*r vehemently,*r and*r immediately*r it*r fell;*r and*r the*r ruin*r of*r that*r house*r was*r great.*r
